result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Shutterly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. COSTS PAID IN FULL
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs.
No contact whatsoever with Ashli A., directly, indirectly or through a 3 rd party.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Case 14CM1181 was dismissed and read into: 14CF719 and 14CF780.

defendant.name: Shutterly, Christopher L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher L Shutterly in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy C. Evans.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 18 months)  Stayed for 2 years  Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 - apply bail from this file and 14CF719 
- DNA Surcharge of  $250.00 - apply bail from this file and 14CF719
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. 
No contact whatsoever with Ashli A. directly, indirectly or through a 3rd party. DNA sample if not yet provided.

Defendant Christopher L Shutterly in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy C. Evans.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a date for plea/sentencing in early September. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Christopher L Shutterly in court, in custody, with attorney Megan Barbara.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Barbara will be replaced with another attorney from her firm, as she will be moving out of the area. Defendant has no objection.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Ashli A. listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Christopher L Shutterly in court, in custody, with attorney Megan Barbara.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern and Timothy Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested   Preliminary time limits waived. Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects to any bail modification.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Ashli A. listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Christopher L Shutterly in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn Michelle Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
